label: 院政
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: When a Retired Sovereign (Jōkō) or Priestly Retired Sovereign (Hōō) actually ruled, reducing the Sovereign (Tennō) to the status of merely a puppet in the hands of the Ex-Sovereign (In ), then this from of administration was called government by the Ex-Sovereign (insei ). [上皇、法皇、天皇、院、院政]
